author: Terry Graham
comment: Great app and support!  I made a mistake and sent  bitcoin cash instead of bitcoin to the wallet and then made another mistake. Anyway, Bojan Simic from support was able to fix my mistake and recover my coins. Highly recommend!

author: Jumaane Williams
comment: No longer supported or updated and if you have Bitcoin you can't send. An option is a forum on BitcoinTalk to see if its enough people for a class-action suit.
Unable to import back up. Lets me select file enter password. Cant hit submit or anything to confirm password

author: Brandon Burdette
comment: It acts like the send is successful, but nothing ever sends and it isn't loved in the transaction history. Horrible.

author: Red Bot
comment: App keeps crashing over and over and won't let me send BTC only receive.

author: Jon Gladwill
comment: Unable to send BTC. High fees.

author: Alan Cramer
comment: Great wallet if you are into collecting Bitcoin. Except you are unable to pay anyone from wallet. Doesn't matter if encrypted or not. No other way to get bitcoin out of wallet. Don't use.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: Alan, please email bojan@bitcoinsecurityproject.org and I'd be glad to help.

title: Useless. Unable to send Bitcoin.

author: Van Go
comment: No password reset and no links for support in the app. Don't waste your time on this. Doesn't work and no real support. If you've collected on this app you've lost those bitcoin. Probably a scam app. Contacted support and they want my backup. For what to steal my btc. Even sent my other wallet address to get my btc followed by three days of excuses. Will publish full correspondence this evening. Will attach link to a blog about who actually got any issues resolved

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: As mentioned in our email correspondence, I'd be glad to help if you are able to provide me with a backup of your wallet. Without it, there is literally nothing I can do to help you since you forgot your password.

title: Crappy wallet.

author: JustHereToHelp
comment: Most of my transactions either take days, or never confirm. It makes an otherwise fine app near impossible to effectively use.

Has always been slow to confirm 1 hour or so but yesterday I sent 2 transactions and they are both still waiting to confirm. 20Hrs and 14hrs later still "high priority". Their support leads to a defunct web site. You have been warned......
title: Will not send coin

author: Treavor Pugh
comment: I have been trying to send my coins all morning and it will not allow me to I have the blu studio 5.0 hd
title: Will not send coins

author: Joseph Huffman
comment: I was able to get very quick support. I had a small question with how the Backes up wallet works. The help was very helpful and I give it 6 stars! ✨
title: Awesome App and Quick support

author: Ruben Guardiola
comment: Had a problem importing a wallet backup. Emailed support and got quick and successful resolution !
title: Great support.

author: D F
comment: The app will not send my bitcoin, so I have bitcoin I cannot use.
title: Can't access my bitcoin

author: Stephen Townsley
comment: At first this could receive and not send.  I tried this with sending different amounts to 4 different wallets and on the last occasion, after a very long confirmation time I wasn't expecting, it arrived after about 50 minutes.  So this wallet seems pretty smooth and does what it says (eventually). I like the way it works.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: Can you please email bojan@bitcoinsecurityproject.org? OnePlus One is a device we have not tested the app on since it's a bit difficult to get so your help would be much appreciated.

title: Sending Issues

author: Thomas Heimann
comment: 5/8/15 update: Same crap. Still not working !!!!!!??????I installed the app on a Galaxy Note 4. When launching the app I just get a black screen and after a (long) while a pop up that the app is not responding with option to terminate or report. Would love to use this app but at this point a no-go. Also, there is no info ANYWHERE on what kind of NFC Tag to use/where to get it/how to configure for use with NFC tag. I think this info should be provided somewhere.... Thanks for getting on top of this!

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content:
Hello, you can use these types of NFC tags. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00FS4AF0S/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1

We will test the app on Note 4 ASAP and provide a fix.

title: App/Wallet not working - black screen :-(

author: Alexandre Kral
comment: Been spending the past hour trying to get my bitcoins out of this wallet and it does not work. Watch out! Don't put money in this unusable wallet as it is a black hole. I have a Samsung Galaxy S4 for reference...

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: Can you please email bojan@bitcoinsecurityproject.com and I'll help you with the issue. Thanks!

title: Can't send money or backup wallet. SCAM?

author: Justin Tiemann
comment: A simple and easy to use wallet with fantastic security and a hardworking developer to back up his work. Simply needs a error message when trying to send more than you have in your wallet I will give it 5 stars.
title: Great Security

author: Chris F
comment: No customization options like other apps, no calculator to figure out how many bits you can send, doesn't show miner fee, can't set a miner fee.   Also, my first transaction I did with this app my bits got lost.  My wallet says waiting to broadcast on network. I click info and there's no transaction on the blockchain.   It's been 15 hours and my transaction still is lost....     Would not recommend to anyone until they fix my complaints.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content:
Hi Chris,

Can you please email bojan@bitcoinsecurityproject.org and I'll help you with any issues you're having. The miner fee is .0001 BTC.

title: So much wrong with this app.

author: Doug Allan
comment: Problem with encryption with Android 4.4.4 seems to be fixed in this latest version. Responsive approachable dev team.
title: Excellent !

author: Ddb Lzmdc Ouaejk
comment: Bug squashed! Thanks!
title: Can't backup or send! (Fixed)

author: Norm Ross
comment: Security at its best!
title: Great app

author: Dirk Jäckel
comment: Why do I have to choose a password that contains upper case, lower case, digits and special characters? Why do I need to choose a password at all? My phone is locked with a password I don't need a password on your wallet app. Why can't I try your app without choosing a password that I will have forgotten the next time I want to use your app?

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: We enforce a strong password because most people do not use secure passwords. If someone was to access your encrypted wallet they could brute force the password if it's strength is not sufficient. I would hope that you are using a password management tool such as KeePass and not remembering passwords.

title: Enforced "strong" password is annoying

author: Joseph Schubert
comment: I can't get past password selection. I'm keep being told to pick a password that's not easily guessable. I've combined multiple words w/upper & lower case w/#'s even tried throwing in special characters. I understand needing security but not at the expense of not being able to remember your password. After all if I need to write it down so I can remember it that means someone can find it which means not secure.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content:
Hi Joseph, when using a password, we look for commonly used words from a database of 1000 commonly used passwords. You can see the full list here: https://xato.net/passwords/more-top-worst-passwords/#.VBR3ny5dVX4

Let me know if I can be of any assistance. Also, I'd be happy to help you use NFC if you'd like. It's more secure than passwords anyway.

title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 WiFi

author: Aaron Vallance
comment: I requested for the full open-source of the Aegis Bitcoin wallet for Android. I advise that all users only use a minimal amount of coin or proceed with caution until this application has been audited thoroughly in production.   When a software company claims their software is open-source I expect for them to list the full source code such as a github repository upon releasing. This isn't the case with Aegis Wallet and I've had to manually request the release of the source code.   The end-user needs to be made fully aware of how certain applications handle their financial data, private keys, and/or Bitcoins. A slick shiny UI can be nice but in all reality just because it says it's "encrypted" doesn't necessarily make it so.  Look forward to the 'opening of the source' and thoroughly vetting this application.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content: Hi there, the Github repos is now public. https://github.com/bsimic0001/AegisWallet

title: Aaron Vallance

author: Sajedur Rahman
comment: Open source, great design, good security....
title: The best bitcoin wallet I've ever tried.

author: Tanzim Hossain
comment: and this is what I get with this application.
title: Securing your key is the most important

author: Mats Henricson
comment: I tried a really long password, consisting of just lowercase letters, and was told it was weak. That makes you wonder about the security skills of the developers of this app. I won't touch it until this is fixed, but it is a very bad start.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content:
Hi Mats, 

We have made the fixes you have suggested. Please check out the latest version of the app and let us know your thoughts. The github repo is also now open https://github.com/bsimic0001/AegisWallet

Thanks!

title: Password requirements outdated

author: Adolfo Botello
comment: I write this after a much befuddled experience with these coins of bit. 'What's a bitcoin? Why are people using them? What's the point?' These questions were some of the first I've had. After I figured out those answers, I began to wonder how I can secure my few coins and not let the bad guys steal them from me. I hear stories about people losing their wallets or whatnot, and yet here I stand, in defiance, with my phone raised in the air proclaiming, 'I will not let you steal my coins, minions of evil!' Thanks to this app, I can say that with confidence now (because frankly, I was bluffing before... ). I enjoy that this app gives little tidbits and helpful information as to how to download, store and secure my coins. Maybe the world isn't such a bad place. Well, it probably is, but at least my bitcoins are secure, and if apps were made of hope, then I'm a little hopeful.   Best. thang. evar.
title: If apps were made of hope....

author: Juan Diaz Ruiz
comment: Best  wallet ever  NFC and Password encryption  and a plus is the  onsite or of site back up
title: I will recomend

author: Ron Elliott
comment: It has encryption! It does need work in the visual department though, it looks rather blurry on a high DPI screen as if images are being used to create the visual elements instead of the native SDK. Please don't try to reinvent the UI wheel on android and just focus on building a nice wallet, there was nothing wrong with the reference wallet's UI. A testnet mode would also be nice.

reply.author: Bojan Simic
reply.content:
Hi Ron,

Can you please send me some screens of the blurry pages on high DPI screens? We want to make the wallet look as good as possible on as many devices as possible but being open source and volunteer driven we only have so much bandwidth to test on a large array of devices. Thanks!

title: Nice Start

author: Robert Michael
comment: This wallet is definitely #1 when it comes to Bitcoin security. And yet, it has an awesome interface and user experience.  5 stars

comment: Very nice app, great design.

comment: Omg. Best wallet ever!
